title: If 4 people can do the work in 8 days, how many days do 6 workers take to complete the same work? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not always mathematical. There are many tasks that need to be done sequentially. For instance, no matter how many people you have pouring concrete or making the cake batter, the concrete is still going to take a certain amount of time to set and the cake will still take the same amount of time to bake. You might be able to get more concrete poured and more cakes baked, but it won’t shorten the time required exponentially. Some tasks can only be split into a finite number of steps to achieve a reasonable outcome. If too many people get involved, you’ll run into the age-old problem of too many cooks spoiling the broth. Take any assembly line and you will be able to see that there is a logical progression and a method to how the task is divided up. And lastly, some tasks depend on specialised knowledge. If only 4 people know how to do the job and you insist on adding two people to the team, what is likely to happen is the process gets slowed down because your 4 experts are going to have to spend time teaching the newbies what to do. Some skills are easier to master than others: at one end of the scale - learning to wrap a present neatly, and at the other end - embroidering a wedding dress.
4 people can do the work in 8 days Then 1 people can do the work in 1 days = 1/(4×8) = 1/32 Thus 6 people complete the work in = 6/32 = 3/16 So,6 people complete the work in 16/3 days.

Let total work unit be 32. Let Efficiency of 4 ppl be E4. So, E4 * 8 = 32 => E4 = 4 => Efficiency of 1 person E1 = 4/4 = 1. Now, let n be the number of days 6 ppl can do this work. So, 6*E1 * n = 32 = > n = 32/6 = 16/3 = 5.33 days approx.
4people can work in 8 days and the same work has to be completed by 6 workers M1*D1 = M1 *D2 (Formula) 4 *8 = 6*D2 By solving we get 5.33 days..
